item.title: 俄亥俄州最高法院称不能因阿片类药物流行起诉药店
item.description: 俄亥俄州最高法院周二裁定，根据州法律，不能起诉连锁药店运营商 CVS、沃尔玛和沃尔格林因助长阿片类药物流行而在当地社区造成公害。【原文：Ohio's highest court on Tuesday ruled that pharmacy chain operators CVS , Walmart and Walgreens could not be sued under state law for creating a public nuisance in local communities by fueling an opioid epidemic.】

item.title: 美国高收益信贷将在 2024 年实现八年来最佳回报
item.description: 较低一级的美国垃圾债券将在 2024 年实现八年来的最佳回报，这凸显出今年涉足投机资产的投资者将获得更高的风险回报。【原文：A lower rung of U.S. junk bonds is set to deliver its best returns in eight years in 2024, underscoring a significantly higher risk-return payoff for investors dabbling in speculative assets this year.】

item.title: 花旗集团预计第四季度投资银行业务费用将增长 25% 至 30
item.description: 花旗集团首席财务官马克-梅森（Mark Mason）周二表示，花旗集团预计第四季度投资银行业务费用将同比增长 25% 至 30%，而市场收入将达到 "十几美元 "的百分比。【原文：Citigroup expects a 25% to 30% rise in investment banking fees in the fourth quarter from a year earlier, while market revenue will be the "high teens" in percentage, its CFO Mark Mason said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 在人工智能竞赛中，谷歌投资 Intersect Power，本轮融资超过 8 亿美元
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司与 TPG Rise Climate 及其他投资者周二表示，将为清洁能源开发商 Intersect Power 提供超过 8 亿美元的融资支持。【原文：Alphabet's Google, along with TPG Rise Climate and other investors, is backing clean energy developer Intersect Power as part more than $800 million funding round, the company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美联储将于 12 月 18 日降息 25 个基点，1 月份暂停：路透调查
item.description: 据路透社调查，90% 的经济学家认为美国联邦储备委员会将于 12 月 18 日降息 25 个基点，大多数经济学家预计，由于担心通胀风险上升，美联储将在 1 月下旬暂停降息。【原文：The U.S. Federal Reserve will cut interest rates by 25 basis points on Dec. 18, according to 90% of economists polled by Reuters, with most expecting a pause in late January amid concerns about rising inflation risks.】

item.title: 美国第三季度单位劳动力成本大幅下调
item.description: 美国第三季度单位劳动力成本的增长远低于最初的预期，这表明，尽管最近几个月物价上涨没有明显放缓，但通胀前景依然看好。【原文：U.S. unit labor costs grew far less than initially thought in the third quarter, pointing to a still favorable inflation outlook even though price increases have not moderated much in recent months.】

item.title: AutoZone 第一季度利润和营收不及预期
item.description: 受原材料价格上涨和美元走强的影响，汽车零部件零售商 AutoZone 周二公布的第一季度利润和营收不及预期。【原文：Automotive parts retailer AutoZone missed estimates for first-quarter profit and revenue on Tuesday, hurt by higher raw material prices and a stronger dollar.】

item.title: 国际清算银行称，政府债务过剩可能在 2025 年动摇市场
item.description: 世界顶级中央银行咨询机构周二表示，政府债务供应飙升破坏金融市场稳定的威胁已经加剧，该机构敦促决策者迅速采取行动，防止经济受损。【原文：The threat of soaring government debt supply destabilising financial markets has intensified, the world's top central banking advisory body said on Tuesday, as it urged policymakers to act swiftly to prevent economic damage.】

item.title: 阿拉斯加航空上调第四季度利润预期，原因是旅游需求强劲，价格上涨
item.description: 周二，阿拉斯加航空公司（Alaska Air）上调了第四季度利润预期，原因是强劲的旅游需求和价格的提高，使得该航空公司的股价在盘前交易中上涨了 4.3%。【原文：Alaska Air raised its fourth-quarter profit forecast on Tuesday, owing to robust travel demand and improved pricing, sending the carrier's shares up 4.3% in premarket trading.】

item.title: ServiceTitan 在美国首次公开募股中寻求高达 59.5 亿美元的估值
item.description: 软件初创公司 ServiceTitan 周二表示，在 2024 年新股上市的资本市场复苏之际，该公司正通过提高计划出售股票的价格，寻求在美国首次公开募股中获得高达 59.5 亿美元的估值。【原文：Software startup ServiceTitan is seeking a valuation of up to $5.95 billion in its U.S. initial public offering by raising the price at which it plans to sell shares, it said on Tuesday, amid a revival in the capital market for new listings in 2024.】

item.title: 美国敲定向美光科技提供逾 61 亿美元芯片补贴
item.description: 白宫周二发表声明称，美国商务部已敲定向存储芯片制造商美光科技公司提供超过 61 亿美元的补贴，以支持其在国内建设若干半导体设施。【原文：The U.S. Department of Commerce has finalized a subsidy of more than $6.1 billion for memory chip maker Micron Technology to support the construction of several domestic semiconductor facilities, according to a White House statement on Tuesday.】

item.title: 早间竞价：美元重拾强势，中国推动力减弱
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 美国 11 月小型企业景气指数接近 3 年半新高
item.description: 在大选后的欣喜情绪中，11 月份美国小企业信心指数飙升至近 3 年半以来的最高水平。【原文：U.S. small-business confidence surged to the highest level in nearly 3-1/2 years in November amid post-election euphoria.】

item.title: 投资者等待通胀数据，期货价格停滞不前
item.description: 本周二，美国股指期货走势低迷，因为在本周一份可能影响美联储本月货币政策会议的重要通胀报告公布之前，投资者没有下大赌注。【原文：U.S. stock index futures were subdued on Tuesday as investors refrained from placing big bets ahead of a crucial inflation report this week that could influence the Federal Reserve at its monetary policy meeting this month.】

item.title: 亚马逊加入印度快速商务竞赛，试行 15 分钟杂货配送
item.description: 亚马逊（Amazon）周二表示，将在印度开始试运行快速商务业务，美国电子商务巨头将在 15 分钟或更短时间内交付杂货。【原文：Amazon will begin trials for quick commerce operations in India that would see the U.S. e-commerce giant deliver grocery items in 15 minutes or less, it said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 云计算竞争激烈，甲骨文营收未达华尔街目标，业绩下滑
item.description: 受数据库和云服务提供商之间激烈竞争的影响，甲骨文公司的季度收入低于预期，该公司股价在周二的盘前交易中下挫超过 8%。【原文：Oracle's shares sank over 8% on Tuesday in premarket trading after its quarterly revenue fell short of expectations, hindered by fierce competition among database and cloud services providers.】

item.title: 国际航空运输协会的沃尔什表示，全球航空公司可能无法实现可持续燃料目标
item.description: 国际航空运输协会（IATA）的负责人威利-沃尔什（Willie Walsh）周二表示，航空业在实现到2050年净零排放的目标方面进展不够快。【原文：The aviation industry isn't moving fast enough to reach its targets for producing and using sustainable aviation fuel (SAF), the head of airline trade body IATA Willie Walsh said on Tuesday, as it aims for net zero emissions by 2050.】

item.title: 特朗普之子埃里克称将在家族企业与政府之间建一堵墙
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的儿子埃里克（Eric）周二告诉路透社记者，一堵大墙将把特朗普组织和美国政府的运作隔离开来。【原文：U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's son Eric told Reuters on Tuesday that a large wall will separate the operations of the Trump organization and the U.S. government.】

item.title: 拜登警告特朗普不要再次减税，并称赞自己的经济成就
item.description: 一位白宫官员说，美国总统乔-拜登将在周二发表的可能是他最后一次经济演讲中警告说，在唐纳德-特朗普的第二个任期内，不要进一步为富人减税，也不要重演共和党的 "涓滴经济学"。【原文：U.S. President Joe Biden will warn against further tax cuts for the wealthy and a reprise of Republican "trickle-down economics" during Donald Trump's second term in what could be his final speech on the economy on Tuesday, a White House official said.】

item.title: 尽管存在供应链问题，全球航空公司仍将在 2025 年实现增长
item.description: 全球航空公司周二上调了 2025 年的利润预期，与上一年相比，预计全行业收入将首次超过一万亿美元，全球乘客人数将达到创纪录的 52 亿人次，尽管供应链仍面临困境。【原文：Global airlines on Tuesday raised their profit forecast for 2025 compared to the prior year, projecting industry-wide revenues at more than a trillion dollars for the first time and a record 5.2 billion passengers globally despite ongoing supply chain woes.】

item.title: 中国光大集团前董事长因贪污受贿入狱 12 年
item.description: 中国国家广播公司中央电视台周二称，中国光大集团前董事长唐双宁因贪污、受贿和滥用职权谋取私利被判处 12 年有期徒刑。【原文：China Everbright Group's former chairman Tang Shuangning was sentenced to 12 years in prison for corruption, bribery, and abusing his position for personal gains, state broadcaster CCTV said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 伦敦金丝雀码头求助于阿波罗，进行 777 美元贷款再融资交易
item.description: 伦敦金丝雀码头商业区周二表示，已同意向美国投资巨头阿波罗公司借款 6.1 亿英镑（7.77 亿美元），用于偿还未来两年到期的债券。【原文：London's Canary Wharf business district said on Tuesday it had agreed to borrow 610 million pounds ($777 million) from U.S. investment giant Apollo to repay bonds due over the next two years.】

item.title: Stellantis 与中国 CATL 将在西班牙投资 43.3 亿美元建设电动汽车电池工厂
item.description: Stellantis 和中国电池制造商 CATL 周二在一份声明中表示，它们将投资 41 亿欧元（43.3 亿美元）在西班牙北部萨拉戈萨建造一家生产电动汽车电池的工厂。【原文：Stellantis and Chinese battery maker CATL will invest 4.1 billion euros ($4.33 billion) in a factory making electric vehicle batteries in Zaragoza in northern Spain, they said in a statement on Tuesday.】

item.title: 日经新闻》称日本生命以 82 亿美元收购 Resolution Life
item.description: 据《日经新闻》周二报道，日本生命保险公司（Nippon Life Insurance）（NPNLI.UL）将以约 82 亿美元的价格收购美国人寿保险公司 Resolution Life Group Holdings，这将是日本保险公司有史以来最大的一笔收购。【原文：Nippon Life Insurance (NPNLI.UL) will buy U.S. life insurer Resolution Life Group Holdings for about $8.2 billion in what would be the biggest acquisition ever by a Japanese insurer, Nikkei reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 工会负责人称，日本收购可能意味着美国钢铁公司的长期衰落
item.description: 反对将美国钢铁公司出售给日本新日铁公司的一个强大工会的负责人说，他还没有得到未来的所有者承诺确保这家具有战略意义的美国公司取得持久成功的保证。【原文：The head of a powerful labour union opposing U.S. Steel's sale to Japan's Nippon Steel said he has not received assurances that the would-be owners are committed to ensuring the lasting success of the strategic U.S. firm.】

item.title: 中国准备进一步举债应对特朗普的关税政策
item.description: 中国领导人在周一发表了十多年来最鸽派的讲话之一，表示他们已准备好采取任何必要的刺激措施，以应对美国贸易关税预期对明年经济增长的影响。【原文：In one of their most dovish statements in more than a decade, Chinese leaders signalled on Monday they are ready to deploy whatever stimulus is needed to counter the impact of expected U.S. trade tariffs on next year's economic growth.】

item.title: 星巴克任命首位中国首席增长官 - 媒体
item.description: 据中国媒体《晚邮报》周二报道，星巴克中国任命了首位首席增长官（CGO）。【原文：Starbucks China has appointed its first Chief Growth Officer (CGO), Chinese media outlet Late Post reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 英国 Ashtead 公司提议赴美上市；利润预警
item.description: 英国设备租赁公司 Ashtead 周二表示，预计年度利润将低于此前预期，并计划将主要上市地从伦敦转移到其最大的市场美国。【原文：UK equipment rental firm Ashtead said on Tuesday that it expects annual profit to come in below previous expectations and that it plans to shift its primary listing from London to the United States, its biggest market.】

item.title: 习近平表示，中国对实现今年的增长目标充满信心
item.description: 中国国家主席习近平周二表示，中国对实现今年的经济增长目标和继续发挥世界最大经济增长引擎作用充满信心。【原文：Chinese President Xi Jinping said on Tuesday that China had full confidence in achieving this year's economic growth target and in continuing to play the role of the world's largest engine of economic growth.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行为二月降息敞开大门
item.description: 澳大利亚最高央行行长周二为最早在二月份降息敞开了大门，但他强调，经济数据流必须让央行更有信心地相信通胀正在如期放缓。【原文：Australia's top central banker on Tuesday left open the door to a cut in interest rates as early as February, but emphasised the flow of economic data would have to give the bank more confidence that inflation was slowing as desired.】
